title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cells with too many chromosomes do not live

· Organisms with too many chromosomes are likely sterile
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cells with too many chromosomes do not live

· Organisms with too many chromosomes are likely sterile

Student response earns one of the available points.

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cells with too many chromosomes do not live

· Organisms with too many chromosomes are likely sterile

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Description of movement (1 point)

· Increased osmolarity/decreased water potential (of perivitelline space)

· (Perivitelline space becomes) hypertonic to its surroundings

Description of expansion (1 point)

· Water movement adds volume

· Water movement increases pressure
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

Description of movement (1 point)

· Increased osmolarity/decreased water potential (of perivitelline space)

· (Perivitelline space becomes) hypertonic to its surroundings

Description of expansion (1 point)

· Water movement adds volume

· Water movement increases pressure

Student response earns one of the available points.

Description of movement (1 point)

· Increased osmolarity/decreased water potential (of perivitelline space)

· (Perivitelline space becomes) hypertonic to its surroundings

Description of expansion (1 point)

· Water movement adds volume

· Water movement increases pressure

Student response earns two of the available points.

Description of movement (1 point)

· Increased osmolarity/decreased water potential (of perivitelline space)

· (Perivitelline space becomes) hypertonic to its surroundings

Description of expansion (1 point)

· Water movement adds volume

· Water movement increases pressure
